thread.title: USF Women’s Basketball Resets Program Attendance Record In 62-43 Win Against Merrimack On Education Day
thread.title_full: USF Women’s Basketball Resets Program Attendance Record In 62-43 Win Against Merrimack On Education Day

author: @USFWBB
title: USF Women’s Basketball Resets Program Attendance Record In 62-43 Win Against Merrimack On Education Day
text: Stephen Galvin / University of South Florida Athletics Box Score 43 Merrimack Merri 4-3,0-0 MAAC 62 Winner South Fla. USF 5-5,0-0 AAC Merrimack Merri 4-3,0-0 MAAC 43 Final Dec. 05, 2024 62 South Fla. USF 5-5,0-0 AAC Winner Score By Periods Team 1 2 3 4 F Merrimack Merri 9 9 8 17 43 South Fla. USF 15 14 22 11 62 Game Recap: Women's Basketball | December 05, 2024 USF Women’s Basketball Resets Program Attendance Record In 62-43 Win Against Merrimack On Education Day Tampa, Fla. –Dec. 5, 2024 – South Florida women's Basketball (5-5) topped Merrimack (4-3), 62-43 on Education Day in the Yuengling Center on Thursday afternoon. ?? Record BROKEN (Again ??)??#HornsUp ? | #RunWithUs pic.twitter.com/tESZJzpZsr— USF Women's Basketball (@USFWBB) December 5, 2024 USF hosted a record-breaking crowd of 9,821 Bulls fans, resetting its home attendance record and is the second-highest home regular season women's basketball game in the state of Florida on record. Sophomore guard Vittoria Blasigh (13 points) and junior forward Carla Brito (11 points) were the pair of USF performers to finish the day with double-digit points. Paloma Garcia led the visiting Warriors with 11 points. HOW THE GAME WAS DECIDED Midway through the third frame, the Bulls pieced together a 15-2 scoring run and Brito led the way with seven points within the stretch. Graduate guard Mama Dembele also contributed four points in the run as USF cruised to victory. COACH FERNANDEZ SAID HIGHLIGHTS Highest Attendance for Division I Regular-Season Home Game in the State of Florida – All-Time (Women) DATE TEAMS ATT ARENA 02/11/2001 Tennessee at Florida 12,222 Stephen C. O'Connell Center 12/5/2024 Merrimack at South Florida 9,821 Yuengling Center 11/30/2023 Charleston Southern at South Florida 9574 Yuengling Center 01/28/2018 Notre Dame at Florida State 9,498 Donald L. Tucker Center 01/29/2000 UConn at Miami (FL) 9,276 Miami Arena 02/08/2009 Tennessee at Florida 8,060 Stephen C. O'Connell Center NOTABLE NUMBERS USF hosted a record-breaking crowd of 9,821 Bulls fans, resetting its home attendance record and is the second-highest home regular season women's basketball game in the state of Florida on record. The Bulls are now 63-5 in nonconference home games since the 2014-15 season. Dembele (1 assist) is a single assist away from hitting the 500-assist milestone. UP NEXT South Florida will face the defending national champions South Carolina on Sunday, Dec. 15 in Columbia, S.C. Tip-off is slated for 2 p.m. and the game will air live on the SEC Network. South Florida welcomes Jacksonville to the Yuengling Center on Wednesday, Nov. 20. Tipoff is slated for 7 p.m. and the action will stream live on ESPN+. TICKETS Fans can purchase women's basketball tickets by calling 1-800-GoBulls or at USFBullsTix.com. ABOUT SOUTH FLORIDA WOMEN'S BASKETBALL South Florida women's basketball has made 18 postseason tournament appearances and had nine NCAA Tournament berths in head coach Jose Fernandez's 25 seasons. The all-time winningest coach in program history, Fernandez has guided the Bulls to 11 20-win seasons, two WNIT final four appearances, the 2008-09 WNIT championship, has won over 450 career games, and is the all-time wins leader in the American Athletic Conference. For complete coverage of USF women's basketball, follow the Bulls on social media (Twitter | Facebook | Instagram). – #GoBulls –Print Friendly Version
